alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 12:47PM MDT until August 21 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Below Acme affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Pecos River below Acme. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Left bank is ~10ft above gage and subject to overflow * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Pecos River Acme 13.0 8.0 Sat 11 am MD 12.6 7.6 7.1 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 915 PM MDT.
